A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Vastly copied & pasted from ESB/RotJ\, turned into a 150 minute gag reel by splattergun of over-the-top\, inappropriate humour. Impossible to generate or maintain drama. The 'hero' (Rey) is a model of social media narcissism: 'I don't need to train\, I demand instant ability'. And the film bends over to give her it.

There's nothing left to care about for Episode IX. No capable villain\, no cohesive threat to the galaxy\, no plausible hero\, no notable rebellion.

Can anyone say\, 'Babylon 5 season five'...?
